ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Soloing bards
ygData.msgSnippet: I was in Chef/Bar/Armorer the other night (Chef, pulling from the others) with my recently-standard group of Cleric, Paladin, Shaman plus a Mage and another
ygData.messageBody:
I was in Chef/Bar/Armorer the other night (Chef, pulling from the others) with my recently-standard group
of Cleric, Paladin, Shaman plus a Mage and another Shaman. We did great for four hours, the Cleric left,
we got a replacement Cleric who wanted to come down (I would have taken anything with that group, but that
was all that was at the zone). She got down, saw there was no Enchanter, and gated! We had to get
somebody else! I got 3 blue bubbles in five hours. Her loss.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 56 songs, Innoruuk


"Reeves, Patrick W" wrote:

> Right on Polanya. Been in many Sebilis groups with a shaman or druid as
> primary healer. In those groups I always go for healing and haste (used to
> be nivs+hymn+haste, now Catana+nivs+haste). The only thing that annoys me
> more then the 'we have to have a healer' types is the 'have to have a
> chanter' types. Was in Sebilis the other night and we had blast in the
> bar/armorer rooms. I was primary CC and we were doing great. Group broke up
> and the next group I was in spent the next two hours whining about how we
> had to have and enchanter. We could have easily gone down and rebroken the
> bar/armorer area, but instead did Gangrenous *yawn*.
>
> Rokenn
